projects.title: Implementation Engineer at (Zero)70 IT Services
projects.description: (Zero)70 was in the process of upgrading network equipment for 'Van Ameyde Group'. Anton was a member of the implementation engineers group. This group was responsible for the replacement of the switches, routers and firewalls at the European branch offices.

contributors.headline: Owner at De Vreugd IT Consultancy

projects.title: AppSense Specialist for Uni Systems
projects.description: The IT-service provider Uni Systems is responsible for the development of a new XenApp environment for a banking company in Greece. In order to regulate access to network resources they planned to use AppSense Application Manager in the new infrastructure. Anton was responsible for the design of the AppSense components and configuration. To accomplish this he worked closely with a Uni Systems engineer at the customer site to gather information before he created the design.

projects.title: System Engineer at Glencore Grain
projects.description: Glencore Grain is a major international trader of agricultural products. The Rotterdam office offers several IT-services to the local office as well as remote branch offices. At the local office around 400 workplaces are served. The remote offices mainly use Citrix XenApp to connect to the corporate IT-services. I was a member of the engineering team. This team is responsible for a stable IT-infrastructure to support the core business. This means the team takes care of day-to-day business as well as project to improve or renew part of the IT-environment. During my time at Glencore Grain we had started a project to move IT-services from the branch offices to central data centers. We also created a new Windows 2012 R2 based Citrix XenApp 7 environment. For managing the user workspace the AppSense DesktopNow suite is in use.

contributors.headline: Owner at De Vreugd IT Consultancy

projects.title: System Engineer at Fujitsu Technology Solutions
projects.description:
At Fujitsu Technology Solutions Anton was a member of the Server Bases Computing team of the department Remote Infrastructure Management. The department Remote Infrastructure Management is responsible for the administration, maintenance and development of the IT-infrastructures serving the customers of Fujitsu. The SBC team is responsible for several Citrix XenApp/XenDesktop farms. This team is also in charge of the AppSense DesktopNow implementations.
Besides this Anton participated in a project for a new Fujitsu customer. Together with a Xerox engineer he was in charge the printer migration. The printer environment included a 'follow-me' print solution based Xerox multi-functionals and Equitrac software.
